newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Changan 1996 net profit falls 11 percent.
newsitem.headline: Changan 1996 net profit falls 11 percent.

text.p: (in millions of yuan unless stated, against 1995 figures)
Earnings per share 0.29 yuan vs 0.48 yuan
Net assets per share 1.95 yuan vs 1.54 yuan
Company name: Chongqing Changan Automobile Co Ltd.
NOTE: The results, calculated under Chinese accounting standards, were published in a statement in the Shenzhen-based Securities Times on Wednesday.
Net profit was 202.83 million yuan in 1996 under international standards, the statement said.
In its B share offer prospectus, Changan projected net profits of 220.42 million yuan for 1996, compared with 220.16 million booked for 1995 under international standards.
The firm's 1995 turnover was 2.4 billion yuan under international standards, according to the prospectus.
Changan proposed a cash dividend of 0.03025 yuan per share from its 1996 profit, pending approval of shareholders at an annual meeting scheduled for June 16, the statement said.
Changan, one of China's biggest sedan car makers, listed 250 million B shares in Shenzhen in late 1996.
